reviews.review_msg: Research psych is dry, but future masters/phd students have to take it unfortunately. Dr. Rose is fairly nice and approachable, and presents good lecture notes. His exams test your knowledge without being either too hard, or so easy that they don't help you to learn anything. Average prof.

Research psych is boring, and he couldn't make it interesting - not his fault of course. Lectures are reasonably well organized, and the mid-term was fair. The post-midterm time is MUCH more dense in material, and is covered far too quickly. Expect a lot of independent learning in the last half term

Donna was a dedicated prof however she uses her own notes versus a textbook so unless you understand the way she explains things its very difficult to learn. Lessons were very full of information however felt rushed making to hard to grasp new concepts. Not recommended unless you're willing to work really hard.

Very nice lady, incompetent prof!! Makes the class way harder than it needs to be, an awesome TA will be your best friend for this course. She spends WAY too much time going over useless information and flies over important formulas. Ended up with a decent mark but had to work very hard for it...avoid taking this class with her at all costs.

This course should NOT be taken with her. Take this course with someone else if you can. She makes the concepts harder than need be and elaborates on things that don't need elaborating, zooms by things that does need explaining. she's a nice lady but terrible at teaching. TAs are a must!! as is the textbook.

This class was a lot of work, I did it during summer session, but Fouladi was helpful; very passionate, she really truly cared about if we understood.  I recommend this class during summer session, but KEEP ON TOP of your readings! The tests are all MC, yay, but they're tricky, so watch out!
she's a nice person but she's a little spacey & over dramatic. Can't say she's the best prof but her exams are all MC. Class is boring, no need goin to class. just read the text and her notes.

Utterly useless... He said explicitly he had no interest in teaching the course, and would much rather work on his master's thesis. His slides were marred with errors to the point he himself could not understand what he wrote the night before.

Easy marks for the assignments!!The midterm was easy too,just because of his laziness,all those MC taken  straight from the last assignment before the midterm and just slightly changed the orders of the answers and the qs!BUT not the calculations of the written part,the rest was pretty straightforward.He is a very nice and helpful guy.

Where to begin... This teacher is useless. He lacks preparation prior to class, notes are riddled with spelling/grammatical/conceptional errors, and he expresses his disinterest in being there. Lazy and unmotivated to help students as well. If you can, avoid this man feverishly; take psych 210 with another prof.

Ridiculous! Thank god he is only a sessional teacher. He teaches stats to art majors and it is nearly impossible to understand what he is saying. He makes the concepts so much more difficult than it needs to be. If you can, take it with someone else. His tests aren't much better nor is the text book.
